revised_title: Boring Register on Bow Island: South Pacific Expedition
tldr: Captain Edward Belcher, under the superintendence of Mr. Thomas Pass, conducted boring operations on Bow Island in the South Pacific. They reached a depth of 45 feet before the augur broke, but the results and daily proceedings of the expedition are documented. This information can be useful for understanding the island's geology, oceanography, paleontology, and archaeology.
